location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 143: Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, to His Excellency Lieutenant-Colonel Justin Sheil CB, Her Majesty's Minister Plenipotentiary and Envoy Extraordinary at the Court of Persia, Tehran

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell states that since his last dispatch, letter no. 90, dated 14 March 1850, several places north of Bushire, which were occupied by Bakir Khan's people, were taken by the combined forces of Mahomed Kurreem Khan and Sheik Nasir. Hennell reports that these forces then marched upon Chakoota, which was evacuated by the Tungistoonees [TangestƒÅnis] and restored to Sheik Nasir's dependents. Hennell goes on to describe Bakir Khan's reaction to these events and Mahomed Kurreem Khan's return to Shiraz. Hennell encloses a translated substance of reports made by the Agent at Shiraz regarding occurrences in the province of Fars between 1 March and 4 April 1850.
